item.dc:creator: troyh
item.content:encoded: Two Linux "inevitability" stories today. BBC reports on its growing success and Willamette Week talks about the real value of Linux: "It's a question of ethical choices," says Riverdale's Nelson. "In a school, it's public money. How should it be spent? Is it ethical to buy software instead of hiring an art teacher? Me, I want an art teacher--not the Microsoft help assistant dancing on every student's desktop.
